news_header: On Thursday, President Trump ordered the development of reciprocal tariffs on imports to the US, fulfilling a campaign promise. He stated that the US will charge the same tariffs that other countries impose on American goods.
news_original_title: What are reciprocal tariffs? Trump's trade agenda explained
news_text: This follows previous tariff announcements, including a 10% tariff on Chinese imports. Trump believes that the US is treated unfairly in global trade and aims to balance tariffs to boost the US economy. Economists warn that these tariffs may increase consumer prices and could lead to a trade war, while some countries have already announced countermeasures.
